title: Life and Death in Shanghai
description: During China's Cultural Revoluion Nien Cheng was accused of being a British spy and locked up in solitary confinement for 6Â½ years.This extraordinary book is the story of her struggle to survive against all the odds - defying her brutal interrogators and steadfastly maintaining her innocence.When she was finally released - to face years of further harassment and intimidation - she learned that her daughter had been beaten to death by over-zealous Red Guards.Nien Cheng's exceptional powers of description, her acute political intelligence and her humanity in the face of terrifying persecution place her books in the forefront of the finest literature from behind the Iron or Bamboo curtains.
author: Nien Cheng
